subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: The nature of things!
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_02E9_01CA21AD.4BD639F0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

"However, it can not be proven what it is that's talking, so I guess that m=
akes the whole thing invalid of little use." 

Depends on what you want to =
get out of it.

Me-I want solid proof that I am talking an intelligent enti=
ties, preferably spirits of the dead, or non human entities. I have not see=
n enough for me to be certain that is what is going on with this technology=
, however I am not ready to give up on the possibility.

The reason I am no=
t ready to give up on it is because I do believe in that possibility.

Apri=
l

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: purplespacefriend 
  To: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, August 20, 2009 3:35 PM
  Subject: [EVP=
-ITC] Re: The nature of things!


    So what constitutes proof? All I know=
 for certain is that something talks by using the bits of audio from radio =
stations as the tunign is swept. However, it can not be proven what it is t=
hat's talking, so I guess that makes the whole thing invalid of little use.=
 

  Frank-S

  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" <april@=
...> wrote:
  >
  > "Just because speech is all perception does not make in=
valid--that even normal speech is highly subjective. If you used the rules =
of these scienctists, you couldn't even trust what the guy sitting next to =
you was saying. You couldn't trust what you were hearing!"
  > 
  > You're =
right....and I don't LOL! All I hope to be able to do is find proof of actu=
al spirit communication. I don't care so much about what is being communica=
ted, only that it is.
  > 
  > --------------------------------------------=
--------------
  > 
  > 
  > "Even it was all imagination, that does not ma=
ke it invalid or useless. It's still serves as personal insight. "
  > 
  >=
 I absolutely agree.
  > 
  > ----- Original Message ----- 
  > From: purpl=
espacefriend 
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  > Sent: Thursday, August 2=
0, 2009 7:55 AM
  > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: The nature of things!
  > 
  > 
=
  > I think the mind is not physical, and it's only these paranoid scientis=
t types that try to bully everyone into that extrememly narrow thinking tha=
t everything experienced is physical phenomenon only, and must be made to f=
it into that context. 
  > 
  > Just because speech is all perception does =
not make invalid--that even normal speech is highly subjective. If you used=
 the rules of these scienctists, you couldn't even trust what the guy sitti=
ng next to you was saying. You couldn't trust what you were hearing!
  > 
 =
 > Perception is everything. How is it that just before some mass death thi=
ng, like a plane crash or some disaster I see the shadows shift, it should =
not be possible, but never the less, I've seen it happen over and over. The=
se scientific types brain wash everyone into not looking at clouds as you m=
ight imagine you see something--well a day or two before tornados in other =
states I see circles in the clouds here-hundreds of miles away. People see =
me looking up and look at me like I'm insane because of these bully skeptic=
s. You're not allowed to perceive anything unless they tell you it's ok. Yo=
u can't look at clouds, and you can't listen to voices fragments, cuz they =
can't explain away the perceptions. These scientist types are too brain dea=
d to realize they too create thier reality-all those supposed new particals=
 did not exist before someone theorized about them, then they are created a=
nd "discovered". 
  > 
  > Even it was all imagination, that does not make =
it invalid or useless. It's still serves as personal insight. 
  > 
  > fra=
nk-S
  > 
  > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@> w=
rote:
  > >
  > > Assumptions and expectations!? I hear a lot of both of th=
ese concepts in your words and when mentioning your research. Cognitive fun=
ctioning or processing sensory information in order to come to a conclusion=
 or judgement is how we function in this world. In order for your mind to u=
nderstand this physical world you live in it automatically makes certain as=
sumptions about sensory information it takes in. Your eyes expect to see ob=
jects oriented correctly, with the correct color, lighting, reflectivity an=
d shading, and you expect there size and shape to be within scale compared =
to other objects. My point is your senses have a range, which implies limit=
ations. Since this is correct for your senses it is also correct for your a=
bility to understand perspectives with any wide ranging diversity. You are =
able to see and process the information of our physical world just as any o=
ther human being does. That is great for a human but why would you think fo=
r a second,
  > > you could understand the perspective of a mind and voice =
that speaks through a radio from some unknown location.
  > > 
  > > The in=
formation you receive from the other side of your radios or even from thin =
air through EVP's could be completely correct and true no matter what the c=
ontext because you don't know what perspective it is coming from. You are m=
aking a lot of unfounded assumptions about the (dare I say) beings or world=
s they exist in and have a lot of expectations about the information you re=
ceive. You are looking for answers to the wrong questions! Quit assuming th=
at these entities know you or the people around you. Quit assuming they are=
 here for your entertainment as a personal fortune teller. Quit expecting t=
hem to know answers to question they may have themselves (just because they=
 aren't physical doesn't mean they know everything). Don't assume you will =
be speaking to a dead relative or someone you once knew. Go to a fortune te=
ller if you want information about the furture. If you are serious about re=
searching these voices and the equipment used to record them
  > > then ask=
 the right questions. 
  > > 
  > > If you have a box made by Frank then as=
k Frank how the different circuits work, what is the puropose of some of th=
e options, why is the RVG better or worse than a circuit without it? You ha=
ve a unique situation here where the inventor of an important piece of equi=
pment is willing to share the most minute details of how it works without a=
 price tag attached. Some of the other box variations are sold by one perso=
n but created by someone else and usually based on some loose design simila=
r to Frank's. The other equipment made by Bill Chapp and others will probab=
ly stay a mystery because they are sold for profit. Most people who use the=
 different "hacks" know how to make them but don't know much about electron=
ic theory or the behavior of radio waves to understand how they work.
  > >=
 
  > > Point is you have plenty of questions to ask the human's who have b=
uilt the equipment you are using before you can even begin to ask questions=
 of the entities you are communicating with.
  > > 
  > > Regards,
  > > 
 =
 > > Frank R.
  > >
  >
